website_summaries.verdict: There's some brilliance in Nintendo's oddball compilation of party games for the Nintendo Switch, but it should've been a freebie pack-in with the console.
pros: The minigames are generally pretty entertaining
It makes good use of the Joy-Con motion controllers
cons: Costs two to three times as much as it should
Very little in the way of one-player content

customer_reviews.title: Should've Been a Pack-In
customer_reviews.text: 1-2 Switch is a great way to have some quirky entertainment at the party. The mini-games included range from tons of fun to downright silly. At full price, this is not worth anybody's money. The title should have been a pack-in with the Switch. The average Switch owner will likely play 1-2 Switch for a total of 1 or 2 gameplay hours and then be entirely done with it. Had this title been $20 or less at launch, it would be a decent option to pick up alongside Zelda.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over Priced Tech Demo
customer_reviews.text: We picked this title to go with a new Switch purchase based on the recommendation of a friend. However, the whole family felt as though this is more of a tech demo than a full game. The motion controls didn't feel very precise. I almost feel as though the Wii motion controls are as good or better than the Switch motion controls. We put a very little amount of time into this title before selling it off. Perhaps if we had stuck with it longer, we would have gotten a better sense of how the controls worked.
customer_reviews.author: MA from PA

customer_reviews.title: Fun party game, but overpriced for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Fun game to play with a group of people! Really should have been included with the Switch itself though, or at least priced at $20 or less.
customer_reviews.author: Office Ninja

customer_reviews.title: well...its ok
customer_reviews.text: It is a good unique party game. It makes good use of the joy cons and it gives you a feel of the abilities of the switch such as using the kickstand. The only problem is what others have said is for $50 it is really short. I think they should have included this as a built in game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should be a pack in title, only fun when you have multiple people to play with.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fun game, but definitely more of a pack in title rather than a $50 game. It’s a fun game, it’s unique and shows off the Switch’s abilities with the joycons and being able to take the system and play anywhere. However, the novelty wears off after a couple play throughs and since the game only has a couple single player mini games you’ll find 1-2 Switch sitting on your shelf more than it’s getting played. It reminds me a lot of Wii sports, cool at first, but how many times can you possibly play motion control bowling without it getting old? At least Wii sports was a pack in title.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at launch to get my kids into the Switch. We have played it max 4 times for a total of 3 hours per the Nintendo Parental app. So for me it was a great way to show off the Switch novelty factor but in the end the replay value was very low in my household.
customer_reviews.author: TMONEY

customer_reviews.title: Some of the mini-games are fun, but this title gets old fast
customer_reviews.text: As with Nintendo’s launches of the Wii, the Nintendo 3DS, and the Wii U, they chose to make a launch title to showcase unique hardware features on the Nintendo Switch. Some of the mini-games are fun, but this title gets old fast.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gump

customer_reviews.title: Only fun after a few times through each mini game
customer_reviews.text: Only fun after a few times through each mini game. Should be a demo for the Switch and it’s remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good but not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Fun game, but this should not be a $50 game.... $20 or $30 would be a better price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Freeth

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: the price paid for what you get just isn't worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: fun for 2 players
customer_reviews.text: Would be better if it had some longer games and quite a few of them are corny. Would've been a much better game if they made it as a 1 player game too, where you can play against the "computer". All in all I like it, especially the quick draw one. My 6 year old daughter loves the dance ones.
customer_reviews.author: shae s.

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this & we’ve been playing it for hours. It’s a fun game! I would definitely recommend- my 8 year old loves it, but it’s probably good for younger and older than that.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Popular grandmother product
customer_reviews.text: We love this! My grandkids and I can play. It is such fun and if you want to be popular, buy it!!!! We love having our grandkids with us and do this is 😍 for us. Now if you have icky grandkids and don’t want them, do not buy this!
customer_reviews.author: M. Blanton

customer_reviews.title: Neat at first, but gets old fast
customer_reviews.text: The game is fun and makes goos use of swtich’s capability. However, the games are a bit too simple and one could get sick of it rather quickly. Not worth he price tag it carries. I would not pay more that $25 for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Curious George

customer_reviews.title: Love for family fun!
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE LOVE LOVE this game. Different challenges keeps the game interesting. No skills required haha. The hardest challenge is putting the baby to sleep!
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: It's great for multiple players
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic game for if you have a lot of people over. It's a fun party game that is easy enough for anyone to pick up and play. It basically feels as if it is showing of they capabilities of the Joy-Con controllers. This is not a single player game though. It can support anything between 2-20 players.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my boys and my daughter enjoy this game since day one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is a blast! So much fun for the whole family. Can but used by 2 players at once but also can do team competitions.
customer_reviews.author: Christa Veillon

customer_reviews.title: Awful execution and overall very boring
customer_reviews.text: Dreadfully boring, repetative, and not well thought out. Plus, there's no real save or track your progress feature. A fine game for parties but mostly a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: D. E.

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this game. It feels like I've bought three games in one as when me and the wife get into it it seems like we're never able to put the controllers down! Product was in absolutely perfect condition. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Sanbar

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced but fun at parties, if you can get anyone to agree to play.
customer_reviews.author: Alex A

customer_reviews.title: just ok
customer_reviews.text: its alright, gets old fast. was good for the price we sold it a few weeks later. no longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Empire Seven

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for grandkids
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids were extremely exited to receive this as a gift
customer_reviews.author: MichaelMSG

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game to get kids (and adults) up and moving! Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Duck Fan

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game
customer_reviews.text: Super fun two player games! Great for the price too!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Clark

customer_reviews.title: Kiddo loves it
customer_reviews.text: Was a Christmas gift for our 9yr old daughter. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Mom running with scissors

customer_reviews.title: entertaining
customer_reviews.text: super entertaining for parties, my friends and i play it all the time
customer_reviews.author: Laura Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive for what it is. Should have been free.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Something for EVERY kind of player!
customer_reviews.text: There are 28 different games that you can play! It is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Jenevieve

customer_reviews.title: Fun and entertaining for all ages
customer_reviews.text: Great party game for a group of people instead of 2 kids holed up on video games.
customer_reviews.author: ladybugpeak

customer_reviews.title: Kids seem to really enjoy this game
customer_reviews.text: My niece enjoys it. Nintendo knows how to sell to kids & family people. Great job!
customer_reviews.author: Diego

customer_reviews.title: Don’t be fooled - this is not a fun game
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I paid $50 for this? It’s a pretty terrible, or at least half-baked, game. It was like they had 30 minutes to make a party game, and this is what they came up with. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Laveranues

customer_reviews.title: Ages 4 and less.  Not for older kids.
customer_reviews.text: Very boring. Should be free and come with the switch. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jim V

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: fun to play at least once. the kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic Reader

customer_reviews.title: It serves it's purpose to showcase some of the capabilities ...
customer_reviews.text: It serves it's purpose to showcase some of the capabilities of the Switch, but I firmly believe that it should have been a pack-in game for the console. At the very least, it shouldn't be a full price game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son is soooo happy, so what else can I ask for?!
customer_reviews.author: Andres S

customer_reviews.title: Fun Game That Will Make You Laugh
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my 16-year old daughter. She played it with her 12-year old and 8-year old sibs and they had a blast! It was hilarious to watch the food eating contest and the shaving. This game is really a lot of fun, and I could easily see it being played as a group game at an adult party as well.
customer_reviews.author: GreatNorthGirl

customer_reviews.title: Family fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a super fun and interactive game for the whole family to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: GySgtmilhouse

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Games are simple but fun. Overall really should be cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: JRMGU

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The game cartridge no longer works. Inserted into switch, doesn't recognize the game. Other cartridges work on the system.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Came as arrived and there were no problems whatsoever. It was cheap too so that's a plus, same as if I got it at full price. Really happy with how it came out.
customer_reviews.author: Mustafa

customer_reviews.title: Fun for most demographics
customer_reviews.text: A fun way to play video games with people in a get together who aren’t exactly gamers
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: not worth the price good for teaching you how to use the switch and makes a good intro but it should've come with the switch because i never play it anymore
customer_reviews.author: Tech guru

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.  Games get old very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Not as much fun as it should be, especially considering the price. We ran through all of the games in one night and then didn't want to play it ever again. I would rent this one instead of buy. I would give it 3 stars for play-ability, but the price value dings off a star.
customer_reviews.author: Petunia

customer_reviews.title: Came in great condition. Super fun to play with my siblings ...
customer_reviews.text: Came in great condition. Super fun to play with my siblings it wish it was a pack in game with the switch
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Baca

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty fun party game but too expensive at $50 MSRP
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Gets old fast
customer_reviews.text: Limited selection of game modes and overall not very fun.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Reid

customer_reviews.title: All age friendly
customer_reviews.text: Package perfect condition. Family loves the game for all ages, good excercise as well
customer_reviews.author: bryan

customer_reviews.title: Fun game with people
customer_reviews.text: There are a ton of weird concept games, but it’s strangely fun. Quick draw, fake draw, only a few are bad. There are videos showing excactly how to play. Weird, but really fun. But if you have no friends or family willing to play, or don’t go to a ton of parties, it’s not that good. Price is slightly steep, but REALLY fun
customer_reviews.author: bananatheswitch

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: It’s a really fun game to play with the family
customer_reviews.author: David A. Herheim

customer_reviews.title: OverPriced Demo Like Game
customer_reviews.text: This is really a Demo game with extra levels. Don't pay full price for this, hell, I'll send you the one I bought free. Nintendo should be ashamed for releasing a product..uh, before....uh, well you know Microsoft did have Halo. Seriously, unless you're a destructive parent, wait for more games that are worth the price of this DEMO game.
customer_reviews.author: Run Todd

customer_reviews.title: BORING, WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS. I THOUGHT IT WAS GOING TO BE FUN BUT IT GETS SO BORING REALLY QUICK.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: at best fun for a few minutes with a party
customer_reviews.text: Not engaging...at best fun for a few minutes with a party. Would be mildly amusing if free, very disappointing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: kaiser

customer_reviews.title: Rating the game while ignoring price.
customer_reviews.text: Users reviewing based on price are doing a disservice to this game. For what it is, it is very fun! Always a blast to play with friends for a bit and nice to have if you happen to bring your switch to a party or friends house. Is it worth $50? Eh I don't think so. This rating is solely based on the game, not the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael allen

customer_reviews.title: The premise seems fun and we were imagining having a good time with ...
customer_reviews.text: We were looking forward to playing this after reading so many favorable reviews. The premise seems fun and we were imagining having a good time with it over drinks with some friends or having fun with the grandkids when they visit. After trying it last night for less then ten minutes we will trading it in for something actually fun. Felt like a complete waste of money to us. I don't recommend it for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sterling

customer_reviews.title: the worst game on the switch
customer_reviews.text: This game is the worst game on the switch, it doesn' use the switch to its full capacity...I mean games without looking at a screen? yeah...you should pass
customer_reviews.author: Retro (Protorock)

customer_reviews.title: Very Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: This Switch launch title is very easily a new owners first game. This game has a handful of minigames that take 30 seconds or less to complete and there is very little replayability if everyone has already played all of the mini games. If this game is on sale for 20$, it's a good value. Anything more than that is pushing it. The party mode is just a simple board game that randomizes the mini games and has two teams fight against each other, but it's more fun to just pick your mini games from the screen. In order to unlock all the games, be sure to play the first few a couple times.
customer_reviews.author: Gurney

customer_reviews.title: Better than I had expected
customer_reviews.text: A fun, family, Friends game. My family has really enjoyed this game. When I first saw this game during the Nintendo Switch presentation I was like this game is going to be just ok. Well after I got this game this game is actually better than I had anticipated it to be. It has around 26 games I do believe and most of them are pretty entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Kizzle53

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one.  Nintendo could have done better.
customer_reviews.text: Games are a bit simple - was hoping to see as much out of this game as we did with the Wii Sports. It's sort of the same concept - where it "teaches" you some of the flexibility that the Switch provides. But the depth of the games is far too little to really make this game engaging.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Sportsman

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fun party game
customer_reviews.text: Pretty fun party game. My wife will play this game with me so thats a plus. Overall, worth having around for when you have company and they ask to play a game, this is an easy one to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids under 6.
customer_reviews.text: It is too bad that this game does not already come bundled with the system. Some of the games are rather cheesy but my 3 and 4 year olds love it. The 11 year old got bored quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Fall Gibbon33

customer_reviews.title: Fun with the right people!
customer_reviews.text: Fun game! It can be awkward if you're playing with people that aren't into it. Treat like a quirky game board type game. It's just fun and funny and helps you figure out the way the paddles work!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Demo, Okay Game.
customer_reviews.text: It is a lot fun. But after a few game nights I can see it getting old. Definitely a great way to show off the switch to others and see what kind of functions the Joy-Cons have. Just not enough replay to justify the full MSRP. $40 and below on sale or used is a much better deal.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole S.

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: The game is not fun at all to play. The game that came with Wii was 100 tumes better than this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mane

customer_reviews.title: People are harsh, it's super fun
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why people hate on this game so much. Yes it is over priced but it's a really fun game. Spent all night playing this with my boyfriend and a friend and we were having so much fun. The telephone game is my favorite. Plus this game can easily be a fun drinking game for big adults too. Personally I really like it and I'm glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Good if you're going to be playing with lots of ...
customer_reviews.text: Good if you're going to be playing with lots of people, obviously, but as a stand alone full price game I don't recommend it. If the price comes down then I could understand getting it. Honestly I wish I'd have paid $20 or less for it, that's what I feel it's worth. The game does what it says it does though, showcase the Joy Cons with two players without relying on the screen for gameplay, so take that for what you will.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth $50
customer_reviews.text: The game is okay and uses many features of the switch remotes. It definitely not worth the $50 price tag. This is the Switch equivalent of Wii Sports and really should've been included with the console. Wait for this one to drop in price if you can as it's one of the few launch titles.
customer_reviews.author: GingerCake

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This game is nothing they hyped it to be. They provide video instructions for each mini game but those people look like they're having fun. Don't be duped. I agree it should have been packaged with the console but even then I think it would have given the console a bad rap. To compare this to wii sports is an offense to the wii. At least that has some lifetime playability. This was very poorly executed. You might have fun with a few of these games but save yourself and don't spend your hard earned $. The $20 snipper clips game is a better choice is you want multiplayer
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Alright for getting to know your Switch but...
customer_reviews.text: The "games" are more like tech demos like how other people would describe it. Each one only takes about 2-3 mins to do and aren't fully fleshed out games like say Wii sports. It's fun the first few times but once you go through all the games there's not much else. This game should have come with the console or at least be sold for 20 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: fun, silly, makes you laugh, lots of games to try, great for small or large groups
customer_reviews.author: johanna

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I don't get the appeal of this game. The mini games are all very weird. I'm glad I got this at a discounted price. I would never pay $50 for this collection. This should have been a pack in. And why aren't all 28 games available right off the bat? Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Hagan

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This game looks fun, but it's not. The games are repetitive and boring. Wii sports is better
customer_reviews.author: Jinjing

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic game! Great for interaction between people because you ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic game! Great for interaction between people because you face each other instead of the screen. Teens and adults had a blast. The games are funny and it's like Wii sports meets Wii party. I would recommend to people of all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Delphinium

customer_reviews.title: Some of the games are really good at showcasing the hd rumble and it's amazing what ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, not worth full retail tho. Wait until it's in the bargain bin. Some of the games are really good at showcasing the hd rumble and it's amazing what it can do.
customer_reviews.author: Gbfan2

customer_reviews.title: Good game for a get together.
customer_reviews.text: Really fun family game. Whether you are having a shootout, eating contest, or wizard fight, it is quite fun to go up against your family and friends. The team mode is fun as well.
customer_reviews.author: Turner.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: While this game is very overpriced for the quantity and quality of content within it, it is a game that is very innovative and very fun. Don't get this game if you expect to never have a friend to play it with, but otherwise it's a fun party game that really shows the power of the Switch and the Joy con controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun... Once
customer_reviews.text: Had a lot of fun with the whole family doing this for the first time, but the novelty wears off quickly and it'll probably collect dust now. Kinda expensive for such a lack of lastability.
customer_reviews.author: Arc

customer_reviews.title: and they love it! The party mode is loads of fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas gift for my grown son and his wife, and they love it! The party mode is loads of fun, we played as a family and laughed until we cried!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Allen

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Fun game for family and friends of all ages! Bunch of minigames you compete against each other with. Reminds me of the Wii Party game, but updated for the switch with new ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Bailey

customer_reviews.title: A little less than a tech demo
customer_reviews.text: 1-2 switch does a good job of showing off some of the more interesting parts of the new joycon. It fails to do so in a way that makes it worth playing more than one time. A quick run through of the 28 games will be enough with only a handful of them being worth ever coming back to and a majority of them being very easily forgettable. This game doesn't offer anything to really make it worth picking up unless you're really needing something to play on your switch. But games like snipperclips already give you good alternatives for multiplayer fun.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton Bann

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Good, mostly clean, family fun! This has been fun for the whole family and friends. Good quick games with high replay factor.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Oh

customer_reviews.title: The joy cons are surprisingly versatile
customer_reviews.text: with Prime savings, this is generally worth it. The joy cons are surprisingly versatile, and the games are also surprisingly engaging. Great game to play with friends. Not a console-selling game, but a great add on to something like Zelda.
customer_reviews.author: Tobin Mathew

customer_reviews.title: its fun enough to show off hd rumble and laugh with ...
customer_reviews.text: its fun enough to show off hd rumble and laugh with friends. not alot to draw you back often though
customer_reviews.author: viki

customer_reviews.title: Actually a good game considering its really unclear what this game is ...
customer_reviews.text: Actually a good game considering its really unclear what this game is about. This should have been sold with the Switch IMO. This game really demonstrates the power of the motion controls in these new remotes
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: its kool ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this game ... I mean, It's kool as a tech demo/fun to play with a group of people sort of ... but other then that, it sucks. I would rather pay 60 bucks for a Wii Sports port to switch.
customer_reviews.author: Madd.Sweet

customer_reviews.title: $50 game should be $20
customer_reviews.text: As a launch title, and after the Wii and Wii U had a great game such as Wii Sports, I really had high hopes for this game, but honestly it's quite a let down. Unless you've got a group of friends with 15 min to kill (because 15 min is about all the enjoyment you'll get from it), it'll mostly be sitting in it's case. But that's just my opinion. If you like quick little mini games, try it out. But for $50, it's not really worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Fun to play with friends
customer_reviews.text: Don't play it too much. Was fun for the first few nights when played with other people. This game is most fun when played with a group. I have been doing a lot of solo play recently.
customer_reviews.author: Concarne

customer_reviews.title: Super fun family game
customer_reviews.text: We have had so much fun with this game. It is actually a variety of small games. Easy to plan and just a lot of fun. Wish Nintendo would have included it with the switch console
customer_reviews.author: Alan D

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for fun with friends and family but a little light on content, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not worth full price. As many others have said - should have been bundled with the system. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Played it once and never again after trying it. Should have rented it first.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Banks

customer_reviews.title: Very fun you just need friends
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have friends then this game is not for you
customer_reviews.author: GakuJoe

customer_reviews.title: An alright family game
customer_reviews.text: It's not worth what we paid for it. I think it should've come free with the Switch, like Wii Sports. It's a fun enough game, but it gets boring and repetitive fast.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Would be good if it just came with the Switch
customer_reviews.text: Would be good if it just came with the Switch. Not worth the money at all, in fact, I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: maelxich

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This should be free and they should fire the guy the Produced this bundle.
customer_reviews.author: The Z Family

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for a few games and maybe an hour ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok for a few games and maybe an hour of exploring but after that you realize it's just too physically taxing for not much pay off. This isn't much of a drinking game.
customer_reviews.author: Noah H Short

customer_reviews.title: Fun for small groups.
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun, especially with a group of people. Some games are a little boring. Wish you could play with more people rather than just two.
customer_reviews.author: Tarin Fukutomi

customer_reviews.title: Can't unlock most of the games at first
customer_reviews.text: Most of my friends wanted to play what we saw on the ads, weird things like milking cows, breaking into a safe, runway model... But when we first started up the game, we didn't see any of those games. And we couldn't play the ones we did want in the limited roster. So, we just ended up not playing it. At all. So, tis game is a dud at first. We are guessing we can unlock the other games but we've just not gotten to it yet. It's not inspiring us to try.
customer_reviews.author: Average Consumer

customer_reviews.title: The game is fun at first
customer_reviews.text: The game is fun at first, but after playing for more than 15 minutes, it gets old. Not a game you pick up and play a lot. More of something you might play at a family event or something along those lines.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst game ever made.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at Walmart on day one. WORST GAME I have ever bought. If it was free and included with the system, I would have asked for a refund of zero dollars. Unfortunately you cannot refund games, which is silly because it encourages developers to not even try. Seriously! My 5 year old did not even have fun. The only reason I had fun was because it was so funny laughing at how dumb and repeptive the games were. Example, milk a cow....)
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lamb

product_meta.title: 1-2 Switch - Nintendo Switch
product_meta.description: Platform:Nintendo Switch| Edition:StandardA face-to-face party like no other!
feature_bullets: Throw an impromptu party anywhere with anyone thanks to a new play style in which players look at each other-not the screen!
Bring the action and fun into the real world as you face off in wild-west duels, cow-milking competitions, a copycat dance-off.
While the action unfolds off- screen, the audience watches the players themselves instead of the screen. That makes it as hilarious to watch as it is to play - an instant party amplifier!
